descript.abstract: Europe Places represents the populated places of Europe.
descript.purpose: Europe Places provides a base map layer of populated places for Europe.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:250,000.

idinfo.useconst: The data are provided under the Harvard University Site License. These data must be used in compliance with the Site License. This means that the data are only available for Harvard Afiliates for use on Harvard owned computers. The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to ESRI for inclusion on ESRI Data & Maps CD-ROMs for use with ESRI(r) software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on ESRI Data & Maps CD-ROMs. As used herein, "Geodata" shall mean any digital data set consisting of geographic data coordinates and associated attributes. The redistribution rights for this data set: Internal Use Only. No redistribution rights are granted by the data vendor and the data is for the end user's own internal use only. The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on the ESRI Data & Maps CD-ROMs. Proprietary Rights and Copyright: Licensee acknowledges that the Data and Related Materials contain proprietary and confidential property of ESRI and its licensor(s). The Data and Related Materials are owned by ESRI and its licensor(s) and are protected by United States copyright laws and applicable international copyright treaties and/or conventions. Limited Warranty and Disclaimer: ESRI warrants that the media upon which the Data and Related Materials are provided will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of receipt. THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE LIMITED WARRANTY, AND THE LICENSEE EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE DATA CONTAINS SOME NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS. ESRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET LICENSEE'S NEEDS OR EXPECTATIONS; THAT THE USE OF THE DATA WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED; OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED. ESRI IS NOT INVITING RELIANCE ON THIS DATA, AND THE LICENSEE SHOULD ALWAYS VERIFY ACTUAL DATA. EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. Exclusive Remedy and Limitation of Liability: The entire liability of ESRI or its licensor(s) and Licensee's exclusive remedy shall be to terminate the Agreement upon Licensee returning the Data and Related Materials to ESRI with a copy of Licensee's invoice/receipt and ESRI returning the license fees paid to Licensee. IN NO EVENT SHALL ESRI AND/OR ITS LICENSOR(S) BE LIABLE FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS, LOST SALES, OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES, INVESTMENTS, OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS; LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL; OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT ESRI OR ITS LICENSOR(S) HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY EXCLUSIVE REMEDY. Third Party Beneficiary: ESRI's licensor(s) has (have) authorized ESRI to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. As an intended third party beneficiary to this Agreement, the ESRI licensor(s) is (are) entitled to directly enforce, in its own name, the rights and obligations undertaken by the Licensee and to seek all legal and equitable remedies as are afforded to ESRI. In the event that the data vendor(s) has (have) granted the end user permission to redistribute the Geodata, please use proper proprietary or copyright attribution for the various data vendor(s), and provide the associated metadata file(s) with the Geodata. In compliance with FGDC metadata standards, ESRI has attempted to practice proper metadata methodologies by providing any data source information, descriptions, and file names to assist in this effort.

cntinfo.cntinst: In the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact Technical Support by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 909-793-3774; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com; ESRI holidays excluded. Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm. For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows NT Version 4.0 (Build 1381) Service Pack 5; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.1.0.570

dataqual.logic: No duplicate features are present. The shapefile is exported using Avenue request ExportClean. This request verifies and enforces the correctness of shapes.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

citeinfo.title: Global Road Data, Data set 1999/H2 Europe level 2

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data from AND Data Solutions, B.V. Organized the names and order of the attributes. Created ArcGIS(tm) layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView Avenue request ExportClean, and created spatial indices.
Source shape files were loaded into SDE using the shp2sde command by the HGL team. Spatial reference options -180,-90,1000000.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the populated places of Europe.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
The type expresses the importance of the place. The following parameters influence the importance: a capital (always type 10) and number of inhabitants.

edom.edomvd: Village > 5,000. A village (type 16 or 17) is upgraded (one type) if it is very important from a touristic point of view. In this way, each level contains a well-balanced number of town or villages with a more or less equal importance.

Small village > 1,000. A village of type 17 is upgraded to 16 if it has its own postal code. A village (type 16 or 17) is upgraded (one type) if it is very important from a touristic point of view. In this way, each level contains a well-balanced number of town or villages with a more or less equal importance.

Tiny village < 1,000. A village of type 17 is upgraded to 16 if it has its own postal code. A village (type 16 or 17) is upgraded (one type) if it is very important from a touristic point of view. In this way, each level contains a well-balanced number of town or villages with a more or less equal importance.

attr.attrdef: The connection level of the place matches the level of the road on which it is situated.

edom.edomvd: The place is situated on an E-road (European Highway System) (not seamless).
The place is situated on an E-road (European Highway System) and/or important national road that connect all capital, large, medium and small cities.
The place is situated on a main road (on maps usually motor ways and red roads) with secondary roads that connect all capital, large, medium, and small cities, and towns.
The place is situated on a through road that connects all capital, large, medium, and small cities, and towns and villages.

The place is situated on a through road and/or local road that connect all capital, large, medium, and small cities, and towns, villages, small villages, postal code areas, numbered town districts and town districts greater than 1,000.
The place is situated on any road.

attr.attrdef: The name of the populated place.
The prefix for the name, e.g. "la".
The compass direction to the populated place from the conurbation.
The code for the populated place. Examples: Exit number, Community code, Train station code, IATA code, etc.
The code for the country in which the populated place is located. It matches the International Calling Code for the country except for Vatican City and Liechtenstein.
The name of the country in which the populated place is located.
The code for the province in which the populated place is located.
The name of the province in which the populated place is located.
The indicator for if province code is needed for unique making of name.

edom.edomvd: The province code is not needed for unique making of name.
The province code is needed for unique making of name since there are multiple populated places of the same name in the same country.

attr.attrdef: The name of a nearby city for unique making of the name of the populated place. This is needed if there are multiple populated places of the same name in the same province. This city is generally the nearest city to the populated place. By combining name, province code, and uncityname, a unique name is created.
The prefix for the city in uncityname.
The code for the province of the city in uncityname.
The compass direction to the populated place from the city in uncityname.
The name of conurbation to which populated place belongs.
The prefix for the conurbation, e.g. " 's- ".
The code for the province in which the conurbation is located.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports ArcView(r) GIS shapefiles.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
